newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-ZAMORANO SCORES BUT INTER SQUANDER LEAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ZAMORANO SCORES BUT INTER SQUANDER LEAD.

text.p: Chilean striker Ivan Zamorano scored at last for Inter on Thursday but his team squandered a two goal lead in the last five minutes and were held 2-2 by Cagliari in an Italian Cup tie.

Zamorano, under fire for failing to find the net so far in the league after signing from Real Madrid over the summer, headed Inter 2-0 up in the 67th minute of the third round match played in the Sardinian capital
England midfielder Paul Ince earlier put Inter ahead with another header in the 56th minute.
But Cagliari pulled a goal back through a Giuseppe Pancaro penalty in the 85th minute.
Pancaro was then sent off seconds later for spitting in goalkeeper Gianluca Pagliuca's face during a goalmouth altercation in which Pagliuca appeared to butt Pancaro.

Dario Silva equalised for Cagliari two minutes from time to complete a remarkable night for veteran coach Carlo Mazzone, making his first appearance on the Cagliari bench since the club sacked Uruguayan Gregorio Perez this week.
The other third round matches were played on Wednesday with European champions Juventus held to a 0-0 draw at third division Nocerina in the major surprise of the round.
Bologna also ensured there would be a new winner this season after knocking out holders Fiorentina 3-1.
